text: Vincent Delpuech (5 April 1888 – 9 March 1966) was a French journalist and politician. ==Early life== Vincent Delpuech was born on 5 April 1888 in Port- de-Bouc, a village in Provence, Southern France.French Senate: Vincent Delpuech He was educated in Marseille. During World War I, he served in the Troupes coloniales. ==Career== Delpuech started his career as a parliamentary assistant for Frédéric Chevillon. After the latter was killed in the war, Delpuech worked as a parliamentary assistant to Benoît Bergeon. He served as a member of the French Senate from 1938 to 1945. He was re-elected in 1955, up until 1966. ==Death== He died on 9 March 1966 in Marseille. ==Legacy== The Boulevard Vincent Delpuech in Marseille was named after him. ==References== Category:1888 births Category:1960 deaths Category:People from Bouches-du- Rhône Category:People from Marseille Category:French military personnel of World War I Category:French journalists Category:French Senators of the Third Republic Category:French Senators of the Fourth Republic Category:Senators of Bouches-du-Rhône Category:20th-century journalists
title: Vincent Delpuech
